compaction_summary.task: Verify research coverage and detect inter-specialist conflicts for Project Chronos ($2.9B LLIC acquisition)
compaction_summary.next_action: Orchestrator should proceed to Phase 4 (section generation) while spawning 4 supplemental specialists in parallel
critical_context: V3 (coverage-gap-analyzer) COMPLETE: 11 gaps identified (1 CRITICAL, 3 HIGH, 4 MEDIUM, 3 LOW)
CRITICAL GAP: HSR antitrust filing requirements not analyzed (deal-blocking if required)
HIGH GAPS: Agent attrition long-term RBC, ERISA pension quantification, cybersecurity/data privacy

pattern_5.gap: agent attrition long-term RBC impact not analyzed by T1

gaps_identified.description: No specialist analyzed antitrust/competition issues for $2.9B transaction. HSR filing likely required (exceeds $111.4M threshold). Failure to file = $46K/day penalties + injunction risk (deal-blocking).
T9 flagged cross-domain implication but T1 did not analyze long-term RBC trajectory (Years 1-5) under sustained revenue decline from agent attrition ($220M annual sales loss).
T9 addressed ERISA as routine ($50K-$150K) but did not analyze if LLIC has defined benefit pension plan and funded status. If DB plan <80% funded, unfunded liability could be $10M-$50M.
gaps_identified.estimated_exposure: $3M-$20M weighted (30-40% probability DB plan exists and underfunded)

gaps_identified.description: No specialist analyzed GLBA Safeguards Rule compliance, state breach notification laws, incident history, or cyber insurance. Life insurers handle sensitive PII (policyholder data, health information for underwriting).
gaps_identified.estimated_exposure: $2M-$5M (base case breach), $10M-$20M (worst case with class action)

gaps_identified.description: T1 addressed Nebraska DOI Form A comprehensively, but other states' change-of-control requirements (38 states + DC) not detailed. Some states may require separate filings (30-90 day timeline).
gaps_identified.recommended_specialist: data room document review (state licenses, prior change-of-control filings)

gaps_identified.description: No specialist analyzed vendor contracts (IT systems, policy administration, claims processing). Key vendors may have change-of-control provisions (termination rights, price increases).
gaps_identified.recommended_specialist: data room document review (Top 10 vendor contracts)

gaps_identified.description: No specialist analyzed trademarks. 'Liberty Life' is common name (Liberty Mutual, Liberty National Life); trademark clearance required to avoid confusion/opposition.
gaps_identified.recommended_specialist: data room document review (trademark registrations) or IP specialist

gaps_identified.description: No specialist analyzed environmental risks for owned real estate. If LLIC owns Omaha headquarters, Phase I ESA is standard M&A due diligence.
gaps_identified.recommended_specialist: data room document review (real estate ownership, prior Phase I reports)
gaps_identified.estimated_exposure: $1M-$3M if contamination discovered (unlikely for office building)

gaps_identified.description: No specialist analyzed NOL carryforwards or tax credit utilization. IRC ยง 382 change-of-ownership rules may limit utilization.
gaps_identified.recommended_specialist: none (life insurers typically profitable, unlikely to have material NOLs)

gaps_identified.description: No specialist analyzed Committee on Foreign Investment in United States (CFIUS) filing requirements. Only applicable if AFH has foreign ownership >10%.
gaps_identified.recommended_specialist: none (unless AFH corporate structure reveals foreign investors)
gaps_identified.estimated_exposure: 0 days timeline if no foreign ownership, 30-90 days if filing required

gaps_identified.description: No specialist analyzed office leases. Omaha headquarters lease may require landlord consent for assignment.
